structure:Dataflow.common:Name: Retail Trade
structure:Dataflow.common:Description: Estimates of the value of turnover of retail trade for Australian businesses classified by industry, and by state and territory. Unit of measure: AUD/Percent. Geographic coverage: Australia/State. Catalogue number: 8501.0

structure:Code.common:Name: Hourly
structure:Code.common:Description: To be used for data collected or disseminated every hour.

structure:Code.common:Name: Daily
structure:Code.common:Description: To be used for data collected or disseminated every day.

structure:Code.common:Name: Minutely
structure:Code.common:Description: While N denotes "minutely", usually, there may be no observations every minute (for several series the frequency is usually "irregular" within a day/days). And though observations may be sparse (not collected or disseminated every minute), missing values do not need to be given for the minutes when no observations exist: in any case the time stamp determines when an observation is observed.

structure:Code.common:Name: Daily or businessweek
structure:Code.common:Description: Similar to "daily", however there are no observations for Saturdays and Sundays (so, neither "missing values" nor "numeric values" should be provided for Saturday and Sunday). This treatment ("business") is one way to deal with such cases, but it is not the only option. Such a time series could alternatively be considered daily ("D"), thus, with missing values in the weekend.

structure:Code.common:Name: Weekly
structure:Code.common:Description: To be used for data collected or disseminated every week.

structure:Code.common:Name: Half-yearly, semester
structure:Code.common:Description: To be used for data collected or disseminated every semester.

structure:Code.common:Name: Annual
structure:Code.common:Description: To be used for data collected or disseminated every year.

structure:Code.common:Name: Monthly
structure:Code.common:Description: To be used for data collected or disseminated every month.

structure:Code.common:Name: Quarterly
structure:Code.common:Description: To be used for data collected or disseminated every quarter.

structure:Code.common:Name: not available for publication but included in totals where applicable, unless otherwise indicated
nil or rounded to zero, including null cells
preliminary figure or series subject to revision
not currently available due to break in time series
not available for publication but included in totals where applicable, unless otherwise indicated
estimate is subject to sampling variability too high for most practical purposes
estimate has a relative standard error of 10% to less than 25% and should be used with caution
estimate has a relative standard error between 25% and 50% and should be used with caution
estimate has a relative standard error greater than 50% and is considered too unreliable for general use

structure:Code.common:Name: Current Prices Percantage Change from Previous Period
Chain Volume Measures Percentage Change from Previous Period
Australian Dollars per thousand cubic metres

common:Annotation.common:AnnotationText: If a unit multiplier exists the data is recorded according to the combination of the unit multiplier and the unit of measure.

structure:Concept.common:Name: Unit of Measure
structure:Concept.common:Description: Base unit in which the observation value is expressed.

common:Annotation.common:AnnotationText: Codes for unit of multiplier are the exponent in base 10 so that multiplying the observation by 10^UNIT_MULT gives a value expressed in the unit of measure.

structure:Concept.common:Name: Unit of Multiplier
structure:Concept.common:Description: The multiple of the unit of measure for which the data is expressed.

common:Annotation.common:AnnotationText: The use of reporting year end day also specifies that the reporting period of YYYY-A1 references an earlier period (e.g. 2018-A1 will be equivalent to 2017/18 and not 2018/19).

structure:Concept.common:Name: Reporting Year End Day
structure:Concept.common:Description: A month day that specifies the ending day of the reporting periods (e.g. YYYY-A1) within the datastucture.

structure:Concept.common:Name: Reference Base Period
structure:Concept.common:Description: Reference Period that the value has been based against.

structure:Concept.common:Name: Observation Value
structure:Concept.common:Description: The observed value of the variable identified by the series dimension values.

common:Annotation.common:AnnotationText: The measurement represented by each observation corresponds to a specific point in time (e.g. a single day) or a period (e.g. a month, a fiscal year, or a calendar year).

structure:Concept.common:Name: Time Period
structure:Concept.common:Description: Timespan or point in time for which the observation refers.

structure:Concept.common:Name: Frequency
structure:Concept.common:Description: Rate at which data is collated.

structure:Concept.common:Name: Adjustment Type
structure:Concept.common:Description: An original time series can be decomposed into three components: the trend (the general direction of the series), the seasonal component (systematic, calendar related movements) and the irregular component (unsystematic, short term fluctuations). Seasonally adjusted series are produced by estimating the seasonal component and removing this from the original series. In most economic data the seasonal component is a combination of seasonal influences (e.g. the effect of the weather or social traditions) plus other kinds of calendar related variations such as Chinese New Year and Christmas. The seasonal adjustment methodology takes into account both seasonal and other calendar related factors that evolve over time to reflect changes in activity patterns.
